titlestmt.titleproper:
Christine Pattee Lesbiana Collection
ca. 1970-2000 GLBTQ.2011.02

publicationstmt.publisher: GLBTQ Archives, Central Connecticut State University

note.p: Finding aid was created, using Archivist's Toolkit, from word document.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-04-19T13:19-0400

did.unittitle: Christine Pattee Lesbiana Collection

repository.corpname: GLBTQ Archives, Central Connecticut State University

did.abstract: Christine Pattee, a Connecticut native, worked for many years in the Connecticut Health Department. She was a gay rights activist and lobbyist. Ms. Pattee was a founder of the Northeast Women's Musical Retreat (NEWMR). The collection consists of personal papers, records of the NEWMR, books, photographs, T-shirts and other visual materials.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on access to this collection.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Christine Pattee was a lesbian, feminist and gay rights activist long before these terms were socially acceptable. She lobbied for passage of the first Sexual Orientation Bill in Connecticut (1975), and became known as Connecticut's first gay rights lobbyist. Writing and publishing articles about her experience, she helped to educate gay communities across the country about the obstacles that may be encountered with regard to legislation. As an extension to her activism, she helped to organize several musical events, eventually co-founding the North Eastern Women's Musical Retreat (NEWMR). NEWMR brought women musicians from all over the country to Connecticut for one weekend every September, from its founding as in 1981 to its dissolution in 2000. Ms. Pattee worked as a statistician for the Conn. State Dept of Health, and was also active in health care initiatives for women. She was an avid book collector, collecting rare titles on the topic of lesbian love. Christine Pattee entered college an English major and came out a biologist. After stints as a teacher and Peace Corps volunteer in Ethiopia, she got Masters and Doctoral degrees in public health, and worked for many years in the Connecticut Health Department as a research statistician.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Books, periodicals, and phonograph records that arrived with the collection are cataloged and stored elsewhere at the Burritt Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection of Christine Pattee's personal papers include research articles and monographs on feminism and lesbianism, booksellers' catalogs, and biographical information. Records related to the New England Women’s Music Retreat, photographs, T-Shirts, ephemera and artifacts form the major focus of the collection.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Collection is arranged into five series:
Series I: Christine Pattee Papers Series II: Records of the North Eastern Women's Music Retreat Series III: Photographic Material Series IV: T-Shirts Series V: Realia and Miscellaneous
Most series are arranged alphabetically by title of folder.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Cite as: Christine Pattee Lesbiana Collection (GLBTQ 2011.02). GLBTQ Archives, Central Connecticut State University, New Britain.

relatedmaterial.head: Oral History
relatedmaterial.p: An oral history interview of Christine Pattee is available within the Digital Collections of the GLTBQ Archives on the website of the Elihu Burritt Library.

scopecontent.p: Series I: Christene Pattee Papers contains articles, records of the new England Women’s Music Retreat, booksellers catalogs and articles.
